title: Google\Cloud\Speech\V1\RecognitionConfig
name: RecognitionConfig
description:
Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.speech.v1.RecognitionConfig

Extends \Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.encoding
params.description: Required Encoding of audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages.

params.name: data.sample_rate_hertz
params.description: Required Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000. 16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

params.name: data.language_code
params.description: Required The language of the supplied audio as a BCP-47 language tag. Example: "en-US". See Language Support for a list of the currently supported language codes.

params.name: data.max_alternatives
params.description: Optional Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned. Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

params.name: data.profanity_filter
params.description: Optional If set to true, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. "f***". If set to false or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

params.name: data.speech_contexts
params.description: Optional A means to provide context to assist the speech recognition.

params.name: data.enable_word_time_offsets
params.description: Optional If true, the top result includes a list of words and the start and end time offsets (timestamps) for those words. If false, no word-level time offset information is returned. The default is false.

methods.description:
Required Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all RecognitionAudio messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000.

16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

methods.name: getMaxAlternatives
methods.description:
Optional Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned.

Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

Generated from protobuf field int32 max_alternatives = 4;

methods.description:

Specifically, the maximum number of SpeechRecognitionAlternative messages within each SpeechRecognitionResult. The server may return fewer than max_alternatives. Valid values are 0-30. A value of 0 or 1 will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

Generated from protobuf field int32 max_alternatives = 4;

methods.name: getProfanityFilter
methods.description:

methods.name: getEnableWordTimeOffsets
methods.description:
Optional If true, the top result includes a list of words and the start and end time offsets (timestamps) for those words. If false, no word-level time offset information is returned. The default is false.

Generated from protobuf field bool enable_word_time_offsets = 8;
